In a strict sense, it's not a real NTR story by definition de facto for Setsuna is just Ginta's "Osananajimi" but not going with him even hadn't been dating with him once. Imagine, there the girl who you've been carrying a torch for gets married, maybe you'd feel sad but never consider that you're NTRed. Thus I even don't think Ginta is the MC. The plot is somehow common to «The Another World» that Setsuna is the real protagonist, and it's a story about how Setsuna's been "coached" by the hentai teacher as well as being lewd gradually, even becoming to enjoy having sex with that pervert by herself, eventually. The last episode that by knowing the pleasure of sex, Setsuna turns to be sophisticated and full of sex appeal -- completely different from the tomboy character she'd been -- is very impressed as well as showing the high aptitude of Yuzuki N Dash for composing story arc works. That's why I love her works so much.

To the people who say that it wasn't her fault, I both agree and disagree. This is hentai. The age of the characters don't matter because not even the authors take that into consideration when writing conclusions and justifications. If this happened in real life, yes, I would absolutely never blame the teenager who simply doesn't know better. That being said, this isn't real life. If in the end Tomoe told FMC something along the lines of, "You were just a kid being blackmailed and manipulated," then I would immediately change my mind and realize that the author was indeed going for that. Well, that didn't happen because it never does. Never. If that's your interpretation, sure, that's fair and valid. Doesn't mean it's objectively correct, though. Regardless of age, if FMC has brain cells, then there's no NTR.

I don't think anyone should be blaming FMC in this series. She was blackmailed, raped, gaslighted, manipulated while she was still a kid, far far from graduation. I mean there's a whole age progression to show how much she changes. And the ending is when she's an adult and has her own baby and realises what happened to her. Also, she assumed MC didn't like her, they weren't together either. It sucks that she still went with the sensei after being with MC, but she did it because she was already pregnant. I mean look how happy she is to be with Ginta in the first chapter. Although I'd like to have seen more in terms of ending, I can also see how the author leaves it up to us how we'd like to see things conclude. Personally, I think reconciliation and moving on as friends would be the best.

I understand lots of people don't like this, but imo it is a really good story about mental and sexual manipulation. The teacher used weapons like blackmail, false choices, flattery, and attacks on self-esteem to get into the heroine's head. Eventually the heroine, like real life victims and thinks she deserves this and allows the abuse to continue. The epilouge also highlights how victims of abuse and gaslighting often feel: even after being rescued from the situation, victims are still emotionally ruined and oftentimes continue to blame themselves, wondering if they were not worthy of being saved and not taking steps to avoid it. Lots of rape hentai deal with similar themes but the tankoubon format really helps flesh out these themes.  It's not a happy story, but it is a very good and very realistic one.

@loan You people don't actually understand what NTR is if you think the SENSEI, of all people, was NTR'd. If it was supposed to be the Sensei...then it would have been from his point of view. Also, we see him stealing FMC from MC first...and no, they DON'T have to be in a relationship. So many idiots don't seem to get that last part... :/ All it needs is for the MC to have a romantic connection with the FMC that's getting stolen away from him. Why do you think the Japanese, themselves...the AUTHORS, themselves, call this kind of set-up NTR? If a romantic partner or POTENTIAL(the part most people who say this kind of thing isn't NTR doesn't get) partner is stolen away, then it's NTR, simple as that. Why do you think so many NTR stories(which usually fucking have NTR in the title) are about childhood friends that are clearly in love with each other but not actually together yet?

@asef713 You must be new to these kind of stories. This isn't a happy feel good story. Also, there's no information about the MC after ho FMC left with the teacher. For all we know, les friend might not even speak to him. We just don't know. So it's possible he's dating someone else, moved away...or who knows what. A GOOD ending to this shit would be him just moving on. The slut FMC already ruined any chance of a happy ending with them together with her betrayal. And don't sugarcoat what she did... :/

[Continuation...] Seeing as how the entire story is about how Gin and Setsuna feel for each other I believe that he'll be able to forgive and get together with Setsuna. Tomoe doesn't mention or hint at anyone being married or with someone else so its likely that he's still single a year after graduating and couldn't simply forget about Setsuna. So that's what my ending for this story is ahappy end with them both married to each other.

The only way that Yuzuki can redeem herself and this story is to show the Gin and Setsuna happily married together after their meeting or have an alternate true route where Gin and Setsuna concrete their feelings, views, or relationship for each other early on and Setsuna immediately fights and reports the teacher when he first makes a move on her back in school and then show the best ending for them both married with their own baby.

This ends my stupidly long ass review. Now I can finally move on from this fucking bittersweet story and get some sleep.

[Conclusion] I can't fault Setsuna completely for her decisions back then. I noticed that Gin helped her develop an insecurity for her feminine charms by always comparing her to a brother and denying that she had any womanly traits. He indirectly caused her insecurity and the teacher used that against her by always complimenting her looks, beauty and body. There's plenty of panels where thats made obvious, and because of that she didn't report him and even gave into him after mistaking the Tomoe's confession to Gin. Gin always complimented Tomoe and thought he liked her so after the fake confession, she probably used her marriage proposal with the teacher to forget and move on from Gin. But I didn't see a ring on Setsuna's hands so its likely that she was only living with the teacher during her pregnancy until he changed jobs and had sex with other girls. She also maybe never even liked the teacher she only liked that he was the only one who saw her as a woman and she went with that.

(Continuation...) This means that Setsuna was having sex anywhere from 6-10 months if we take extremes into account. (June-March or Oct-March)

Then the epilogue takes place years after and Setsuna's child has been born and judging from how old he is I'd say he's anywhere from 1-6 months old. So the epilogue takes place about 9-12 months after their graduation so it would be around Jan-March of the following year.

(Continuation...) One of the Setsuna's kouhai talks about the interhigh competition for swimming in the beginning of the story, unfortunately I don't know when exactly Japanese Highschools have their swim meets so I'm gonna guess with sometime between late July and early August so it coincides with their summer break. We can conclude that the first 3 sex scenes happen before that so sometime in June-July over the span of around 3 days. (On a Fri-Sat-Sun)

Tomoe's misunderstood confession comes supposedly the following Monday morning though an unspecified amount of time before Oct is also viable. Next the time jumps to after the change back to the Winter uniforms but Setsuna has longer hair so I'll land the 4th and 5th sex scenes anywhere from December to March respectively with the 1st sex scene in Late March-Early May. (Continued...)

Ok so I'm just gonna give my opinion and a sort of analysis (but mostly rambling) on what I think of the story as well as the conclusion so I can finally have some damn peace.

Timeline: (I'll exclude the childhood flashbacks since the exact year they happened won't change anything.)

The story takes place in their senior year, as stated by Tomoe and Ginta during one of their conversations.  Now school for them starts in early April, with them debuting in their winter uniforms (like in one of their minor flashbacks). Then in early June they switch to the Summer uniforms where most of the story takes place in. Starting in early October they switch to their Winter Uniforms again for the remainder of the school year.

Now most of their early school year was pretty uneventful until sometime after or during June when the story starts... (Continued...)
